alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:25PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Converse County through 430 PM MDT... At 325 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Evansville, or 12 miles east of Casper, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Rolling Hills Estates and Deer Creek. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 153 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Wyoming.
